programme.desc: This episode celebrates Charlie Chaplin and includes highlights from his comedy career while host and comedy writer, Barry Cryer, recalls some of his funniest moments.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: Francesca Chiorando is on a quest to discover the truth behind the city of Naples, to see if it is a kingdom of violence and a culture obsessed with death.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: Francesca Chiorando uncovers Edinburgh's gruesome past, back when grave robbing, bodysnatching and murder were rife.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: Francesca Chiorando dives into life in Cornwall to discover the ancient practices of witchcraft and smuggling.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: Francesca is on a quest to discover why Icelandic people believe in mythical creatures.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: Francesca goes on a high-octane adventure in Snowdonia, one of the most remote corners of the UK.

programme.title: Access All Areas
programme.desc: In Morocco, Francesca experiences life on the edge of human capability and takes on a survival challenge walking alone amongst the sand dunes of the Sahara.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James returns to his former home city of Los Angeles, where he reconnects with old friends working in accessibility in the entertainment industry, enjoys Korean BBQ, street food, and hits the beach for a little surfing.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: After a surprise invite to visit the head of accessibility at Microsoft's headquarters in Seattle, James heads to Vancouver, known for its breathtaking natural beauty and self-proclaimed title of "most accessible city in the world."

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James sets out to discover what it's like to travel blind in the Big Apple, to see if someone like him can make it there.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James heads across the pond to discover what life for a blind traveler is like in a world capital like London; he dives into the nation's crown cuisine of Indian food and learns a new sport, created by and for the visually impaired.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: Escaping the hustle and bustle of the big city, James takes the train to visit the rest of England; from ghost tours and hiking in Scotland, to football in Liverpool, to an epic thrill ride in Wales.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his older brother Colton head to Austin, Texas to sample BBQ from a blind pitmaster and live music from a blind musician; ashort road trip to Houston connects them with blind celebrity chef Christine Ha.

programme.title: Blindspots
programme.desc: James and his sister Cassie visit Frankfurt and Mainz, enjoying beer and brats, and exploring Germany's infrastructure of support for the visually impaired; this culminates in a tour of the Dialogue Museum.
